intro: Strychnos philippensis, commonly known as the Philippine strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when mature, turning red when ripe. It is often found in lowland to montane forests and is adapted to moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
